PRIME MINISTER 114/ 93
STATEMENT BY THE PRIME MINISTER, THE HON P J KEATING, MP
APEC BUSINESS CONSULTATIVE PANEL
I am very much looking forward to participating in the informal APEC Leaders
Economic Conference to be hosted by President Clinton in Seattle on
November.
The meeting represents a historic opportunity for the Asia-Pacific region. It
will build on the increasing economic integration o6 the APEC economies and
give expression to the growing sense of community in our region as well as
focusing the world's attention on the dynamism of Asia.
The active participation of the private sectors of the APEC economies
including Australian business is integral to the success of APEC's further
development. Governments can show the way and create the right conditions
for the development of trade and investment. Ultimately, it is for business to
export and invest.
SI regard it. as essential, in the lead-up to such a significant event, to hear the
views of Australian business about the way ahead for APEC.
I have therefore decided to establish an APEC Business Consultative Panel
which I will chair to assist me in preparing for the November Leaders
meeting. I have invited the following senior Australian business people to
participate in the Panel:
